spell.name: Albatross Curse
entries: You create a spectral albatross, a guiding bird for sailors, to hover around the target. You and allies within 30 feet of the target gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attacks against the target. The target creature can spend an action to {@action Strike|PC1} the albatross, which automatically succeeds and kills it. The target must then attempt a Will save against your spell DC.

Success: The guilt of slaughtering a bird of good fortune weighs on the target's mind. The target is {@condition stupefied|PC1|stupefied 1} for 1 round.
Failure: The albatross hangs around a cord from the target's neck (or closest equivalent) for 1 minute, cursing them for their transgression. During this time, the target must roll twice and take the worse result on their next Will save, after which the albatross disappears.
Critical Failure: As failure, but the duration is 1 hour.

spell.name: Antlion Trap
entries: You transmute the ground into a conical pit trap of loose sand that becomes difficult terrain for the duration. A creature or unsecured object that enters the sand or starts its turn in the sand is moved toward the center, depending on the result of its Reflex save. This is forced movement. If there isn't enough space near the center of the pit, affected creatures and objects move as far as they can without being blocked, up to the amount set by their saving throw outcomes.

Success: The creature moves 5 feet toward the center.
Failure: The creature moves 10 feet toward the center.
Critical Failure: As failure, and the creature becomes {@condition immobilized|PC1} in the pit. It can attempt to {@action Escape|PC1} against your spell DC.

2: Increase the area of the spell and the amount a creature moves on a failure by 5 feet.

spell.name: Camel Spit
entries: You alter your stomach, esophagus, and tongue to be able to spit partially digested food with force. You can spit at a foe once you finish Casting the Spell and can repeat the attack once on each of your subsequent turns by taking a single action, which has the {@trait acid}, {@trait attack}, and {@trait concentrate} traits. After your third spit attack, the spell ends. When you attack with camel spit, make a ranged spell attack roll against a creature within 15 feet, dealing {@damage 1d6} acid damage and causing the target to be {@condition dazzled|PC1} for 1 round if you hit. On a critical hit, you deal double damage and the target takes 1 {@condition persistent damage|PC1|persistent acid damage}.

1: The damage increases by {@damage 1d6}, and the {@condition persistent damage|PC1} on a critical hit is increased by 1.

spell.name: Claws of the Otter
entries: Webbing grows between your fingers and your nails extend into vicious claws. For the spell's duration, you gain a +1 status bonus to {@skill Athletics|PC1} checks to {@action Swim|PC1} and you gain a claws unarmed attack. They're an agile, finesse, unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d4} slashing damage and an additional {@damage 1d6} cold damage.

3: The additional cold damage increases by {@damage 1d6}.

spell.name: Confusing Cry
entries: You give an unsettling, warbling cry that causes nearby creatures to lash out without control. Each creature in the area that can hear must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success: The target is unaffected and immune to this spell for 1 minute.
Failure: The target is {@condition confused|PC1} for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the confusion.
Critical Failure: As failure, and the creature immediately attacks itself. This {@action Strike|PC1} doesn't give the creature a flat check to recover from the confusion.

spell.name: Croak Voice
entries: You cause the target creature's vocal chords to swell like those of a frog. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

Success: The target's voice becomes hoarse, and speaking becomes painful. Whenever it uses an action that has the {@trait auditory} trait or attempts to Cast a Spell that doesn't have the subtle trait, it must succeed at a DC {@flatDC 5} flat check or the action is lost. Once per round, the target can spend an {@action Interact|PC1} action to massage its throat, attempting a Fortitude save against your spell DC. On a success, the spell ends.
Failure: As success, but using an action with the {@trait auditory} trait also deals {@damage 2d10} mental damage to the target as the sound of its distorted voice grates on its ears.
Critical Failure: As failure, but the damage for using an action with the {@trait auditory} trait is doubled, and the target can't use an {@action Interact|PC1} action to attempt a Fortitude save to end the effect early.

1: The damage for using an action with the {@trait auditory} trait increases by {@dice 1d10}.

spell.name: Foraging Friends
entries: Giving a cheerful whistle, you call forth a handful of small animals, such as birds or mice, to collect food for you and your allies. The animals return 1 hour later with enough foraged goods to feed four {@trait Medium} creatures for 1 day, then return to their normal behavior. If you're in a particularly strange environment, as determined by your GM, you might need a minimum proficiency with {@trait primal} spell DCs, equivalent to the minimum proficiency required to {@action Subsist|PC1} in strange environments.

3: The animals bring back enough food for eight {@trait Medium} creatures for 1 day.
5: The animals bring back enough food for 30 {@trait Medium} creatures for 1 day.

spell.name: Frog Tongue
entries: Your tongue extends unnaturally, flicking out toward a creature within range and dealing {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage (basic Reflex save). On a failure, the creature is also stuck to the end of the tongue. It is {@condition off-guard|PC1} and can't move beyond the reach of your tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with a {@action Strike|PC1} that deals at least 10 slashing damage or attempt to {@action Escape|PC1} against your spell DC. The AC of the tongue is equal to your spell DC. Severing the tongue in this way deals no damage to you but ends the spell. While a creature is stuck to the end of your tongue, actions you take with the {@trait auditory} trait take a –2 circumstance penalty. If you move so that the affected creature is outside of the tongue's reach, the spell ends.

spell.name: Hidebound
spell.trigger: A creature within range is hit with a {@action Strike|PC1} that deals physical damage.
entries: The target's skin erupts in thick hide or dense scales. It gains resistance 5 to physical damage, except adamantine, until the beginning of its next turn.

spell.name: Hippocampus Retreat
spell.requirements: You're mostly or totally submerged in water.
entries: You temporarily shape your lower limbs into the tail of a hippocampus in order to swim away from a nearby foe after dealing a parting blow. Attempt a melee spell attack roll against the target's AC, dealing {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage on a hit (or double damage on a critical hit). Then, {@action Swim|PC1} up to 30 feet; if you already have a swim Speed, you can {@action Swim|PC1} up to your Speed with a +10-foot circumstance bonus. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your AC against reactions triggered by this movement. At the end of the movement, your lower limbs return to normal.

spell.name: Luring Wail
entries: You emit a plaintive cry to lure your enemies closer. Each creature in the emanation that can hear you must attempt a Will save. If you speak a creature's name as part of the casting of the spell, that creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to its saving throw. Each creature that enters the area on its turn must attempt a save. If you attack or take a {@condition hostile|PC1} action, the {@condition fascinated|PC1} condition ends only for the creature that's attacked.

Success: The creature is {@condition slowed|PC1|slowed 1} for 1 round.
Failure: The creature becomes {@condition fascinated|PC1} and compelled to move toward the sound of your cry on its turn. As long as it is in the emanation and can hear, it must spend at least one of its actions on each of its turns to move closer to you.
Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature must spend all its actions moving toward the sound. Additionally, the creature is {@condition off-guard|PC1}.

spell.name: Primal Chorus
entries: You let loose a primal howl that incites animals and beasts to join in the chorus. Doing so gives you a general idea of how many creatures with the {@trait animal} or {@trait beast} trait are within the range of the spell, but significant creatures can attempt a Will save against your spell DC to resist responding to your call. You gain a +1 status bonus to your next Initiative roll in an encounter with an enemy creature that replies to your call. For purposes of using {@action Coerce|PC1} during exploration mode, you can communicate with a creature that responds to your call for the duration of the spell. You can only make simple commands, such as approach or hide, and only understand simple ideas, such as compliance with the order or the presence of natural hazards.

spell.name: Sacred Beasts
entries: You call out to the creatures of the wild favored by your deity. You quickly summon your deity's sacred animal (or a small swarm of them if the animal is usually Tiny). For example, you would call forth a lion if you worship {@deity Iomedae} or a swarm of spiders if you worship {@deity Norgorber}. If your deity doesn't have a known sacred animal, work with the GM to find a thematic one. The animal or swarm assaults all creatures in the area, dealing {@dice 2d6} damage. The damage is either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing based on the animal that was conjured, as determined by the GM. After their attacks, the animals return to your deity's plane.

spell.name: Snake Fangs
entries: Your jaw unhinges as your teeth extend into wicked fangs. For the spell's duration, you gain a fangs unarmed attack. They're a finesse, grapple, unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d8} piercing damage and an extra {@damage 2d10} poison damage. If you have a creature at least one size smaller than you {@condition grabbed|PC1} with your fangs, you can use the Swallow Whole ability that deals {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage and has a Rupture value of 17. A swallowed creature is transported to an extraplanar space that resembles the inside of a snake's stomach, so when it gets free, it appears in a space adjacent to you. If you're killed or the spell ends, the swallowed creature is immediately freed.

3: The extra poison damage of your fangs unarmed attack increases by {@dice 1d10}, the damage dealt by the Swallow Whole ability increases by {@dice 6d6}, and the Rupture value increases by 9.

spell.name: Summon Stampede

duration.entry: until the end of your next turn

entries: You summon an unstoppable stampede of panicking beasts. Whether you conjure wild beasts or tamed cattle, the stampede is a force of nature that leaves behind nothing in its wake. The stampede occupies the space of a {@trait Gargantuan} creature and has a Speed of 60 feet.

items.name: Arrive
entries: ({@trait emotion}, {@trait fear}, {@trait mental}) {@i Foreboding Tremors} The sheer energy of a stampede can cause even apex predators to panic. Each creature within a 60-foot emanation must attempt a Will save with the following effects.

Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened|PC1|frightened 3} and {@condition fleeing|PC1} for 1 round.

items.name: Depart
entries: {@i Flatten the Earth} The stampede {@action Stride|PC1|Strides} up to double its Speed, trampling each {@trait Large} or smaller creature, hazard, and structure whose space it enters, dealing {@damage 8d8} bludgeoning damage (basic Reflex save). The stampede ignores and attempts to counteract all difficult terrain it enters caused by debris, overgrowth, rubble, or thick ground cover.

spell.name: Summon Warden of the Wild

duration.entry: until the end of your next turn

entries: You briefly call forth the spirit of one of the Wardens of the Wild, the legendary guardians of nature. The warden occupies the space of a {@trait Gargantuan} creature. When you Cast this Spell, you summon a warden depending on the biome in which the spell is cast (for instance, summoning the Warden of Caverns and Burrows if summoned in a cave, canyon, or other underground environment). In an unnatural environment, the warden summoned depends on the region's most recent or similar natural biome, as decided by the GM.

items.name: Warden of Caverns and Burrows:
entries: Speed 60 feet, burrow 100 feet; {@b Arrive} ({@trait earth}) {@i Obsidian Cage} Obsidian stalagmites burst from the earth as the warden surfaces, impaling enemies and trapping them in stalagmites. Enemies on the ground within 40 feet take {@damage 6d6} piercing damage (basic Reflex save). Creatures that fail their save become {@condition immobilized|PC1} until they {@action Escape|PC1} (the DC is your spell DC); {@b Depart} ({@trait earth}) {@i Blessing of the Depths} The squares occupied by the warden remain disheveled and broken, becoming difficult terrain. The warden affects you and all your allies within 60 feet with a {@spell mountain resilience|PC1} and {@spell unfettered pack|PC1}. The duration for both spells is reduced to 3 rounds, but the duration of {@spell mountain resilience|PC1} isn't reduced when an affected target is hit by a bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing attack.

items.name: Warden of Forests and Meadows:
entries: Speed 120 feet; {@b Arrive} ({@trait illusion}, {@trait mental}) {@i Idyllic Panorama} The warden's presence unpredictably warps the appearances and perceived distances of creatures and obstacles around it. Each time an enemy within 40 feet of the warden attempts a {@action Strike|PC1} or {@action Stride|PC1} action, it takes {@damage 4d6} mental damage (basic Will save). On a critical failure, the creature {@action Strike|PC1|Strikes} a random target within reach or {@action Stride|PC1|Strides} in a random direction. On a critical success, the creature becomes temporarily immune for 1 round; {@b Depart} {@i Fox's Insightful Trickery} The warden affects you and all your allies within 60 feet with {@trait blur|PC1} and {@trait truesight|PC1}. The duration for both spells is reduced to 3 rounds.

items.name: Warden of Oceans and Rivers:
entries: Speed 60 feet, swim 120 feet; {@b Arrive} {@i I Am the Tide} If the warden is summoned in a body of water, it creates a churning whirlpool that deals {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage to all creatures within 30 feet (basic Reflex save). A creature that fails this save is pulled 15 feet closer to the warden (30 feet on a critical failure). If the warden is summoned outside of a body of water, it creates a wave of water that deals {@damage 8d6} bludgeoning damage to all creatures within 30 feet (basic Reflex save). A creature that fails this save is pushed 10 feet away from the warden; {@b Depart} {@i Acclimation to the Deep} The warden affects you and your allies within 60 feet with {@spell feet to fins|PC1} and {@spell water breathing|PC1}. The duration for both spells is reduced to 3 rounds, but a creature affected by {@spell feet to fins|PC1} retains its normal land Speed.

items.name: Warden of Peaks and Skies:
entries: Speed 60 feet, fly 240 feet; {@b Arrive} {@i Precipice Plummet} The warden appears, flying downward from the sky and sends a shockwave where she lands. Creatures within 20 feet take {@damage 10d6} sonic damage (basic Fortitude save). Creatures that critically fail their saves are {@condition sickened|PC1|sickened 1}; {@b Depart} ({@trait auditory}) {@i Song of the Skies} The warden affects you and all your allies within 60 feet with {@spell fly|PC1} and {@spell unfettered movement|PC1}. The duration for both spells is reduced to 3 rounds.
